name: Buenos Aires
info: The most populated province in the country, with vast plains and strong productive activity.

name: Catamarca
info: Arid landscapes, mountains, and a rich cultural heritage from the northwest.

name: Chaco
info: A warm-climate province with lush nature and cultural diversity.

name: Chubut
info: A Patagonian destination famous for whales, glaciers, and steppe landscapes.

name: Córdoba
info: Mountain ranges, rivers, and a strong cultural identity in the center of the country.

name: Corrientes
info: Home of the Iberá Wetlands and chamamé traditions.

name: Entre Ríos
info: A province of rivers, hot springs, and green landscapes.

name: Formosa
info: Subtropical nature and vibrant indigenous culture.

name: Jujuy
info: Unique colors, hills, and a strong Andean identity.

name: La Pampa
info: Vast plains and rural traditions.

name: La Rioja
info: Reddish mountains and impressive natural parks.

name: Mendoza
info: International wine capital and home to the imposing Aconcagua mountain.

name: Misiones
info: Subtropical rainforest and the Iguazú Falls.

name: Neuquén
info: Lakes, mountains, and the gateway to Patagonia.

name: Río Negro
info: From the Andes to the sea, a great diversity of landscapes.

name: Salta
info: Traditions, colonial architecture, and northern landscapes.

name: San Juan
info: Sun, mountains, and wine production.

name: San Luis
info: Mountain nature and peaceful tourism.

name: Santa Cruz
info: Glaciers, eternal ice, and breathtaking landscapes.

name: Santa Fe
info: An important productive and river-based hub of the country.

name: Santiago del Estero
info: The oldest province, rich in folklore and traditions.

name: Tierra del Fuego
info: The end of the world, extreme nature, and unique landscapes.

name: Tucumán
info: Birthplace of Argentine independence and green landscapes.
